description: Year-over-year change in revenue.
interpretation_hint: Sustained growth suggests product-market fit or expansion; declining growth may signal saturation or competitive pressure.

description: Profit after variable / direct costs.
interpretation_hint: Tracks value created before operating costs; compressing gross profit usually means pricing or cost pressure.

description: Gross profit as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: Low margin limits ability to fund overhead and growth; improving margin increases resilience.

description: Cash available to cover fixed costs after variable costs.
interpretation_hint: If contribution margin cannot cover fixed costs, the business is structurally unprofitable at current scale.

description: Contribution margin as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: Higher rate means each € of revenue adds more profit after variable costs.

description: Operating profit before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization.
interpretation_hint: Core operating performance; useful for comparisons and debt capacity analysis.

description: EBITDA as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: Low margin suggests high overhead or weak pricing; rising margin indicates operating leverage.

description: Operating profit after depreciation/amortization.
interpretation_hint: Reflects operational profitability including asset intensity; negative EBIT can coexist with positive EBITDA in capex-heavy models.

description: EBIT as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: Improves when fixed cost base is controlled and pricing power is strong.

description: Net income as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: Captures full profitability after financing and taxes; can be volatile due to one-offs.

description: Fixed costs as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: High fixed cost ratio increases downside risk; requires stable revenue to be safe.

description: Operating expenses as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: High Opex ratio indicates heavy overhead; may be strategic (growth) or inefficient.

description: Cost of goods sold as a share of revenue.
interpretation_hint: High COGS ratio compresses gross margin; watch supplier price moves and mix changes.

description: Cash generated by operations.
interpretation_hint: OCF shows whether profits translate into cash; negative OCF with profits often means working capital build-up.

description: Cash available after capex.
interpretation_hint: Positive FCF funds growth, debt repayment, or dividends; negative FCF may be acceptable during investment cycles.

description: How much EBITDA turns into operating cash.
interpretation_hint: Low conversion hints at working capital issues, heavy taxes, or poor collections.

description: Months the company can operate before running out of cash.
interpretation_hint: Short runway (<6) implies urgent financing or cost actions.

description: Short-term liquidity buffer.
interpretation_hint: Negative working capital can be efficient (retail) or risky depending on business model.

description: Ability to cover short-term obligations.
interpretation_hint: <1 can be risky; too high may mean idle assets.

description: Liquidity excluding inventory.
interpretation_hint: Highlights ability to meet obligations without selling stock; low ratio may strain cash.

description: Average collection period for receivables.
interpretation_hint: Rising DSO signals slower customer payments and cash pressure.

description: Average days inventory is held.
interpretation_hint: High DIO ties up cash and raises obsolescence risk.

description: Average days to pay suppliers.
interpretation_hint: Higher DPO improves cash but may strain supplier relationships or lose discounts.

description: Time between cash paid to suppliers and cash received from customers.
interpretation_hint: Shorter cycle improves liquidity; longer cycle increases financing needs.

description: Debt after cash on hand.
interpretation_hint: Lower net debt increases flexibility; negative net debt means net cash position.

description: Capital structure balance between debt and equity.
interpretation_hint: High ratio increases financial risk; acceptable level depends on industry stability.

description: Debt repayment capacity relative to operating earnings.
interpretation_hint: >4x often indicates elevated risk (context-dependent); watch covenant headroom.

description: Ability to pay interest from operations.
interpretation_hint: Low coverage indicates refinancing risk; higher is safer.

description: Efficiency of assets in generating profit.
interpretation_hint: Low ROA suggests asset-heavy operations or weak profitability; improve via utilization or margin.

description: Return generated on shareholders' capital.
interpretation_hint: High ROE can indicate strong profitability or high leverage; interpret with debt metrics.

description: Return on capital deployed in operations.
interpretation_hint: ROIC above WACC indicates value creation; below implies value destruction.

description: Revenue generated per unit of assets.
interpretation_hint: Higher turnover signals efficient asset use; low turnover may mean underutilized capacity.

description: How often inventory is sold and replaced.
interpretation_hint: Low turnover ties up cash; too high may risk stockouts.

description: Revenue required to cover fixed costs at current unit economics.
interpretation_hint: If current revenue < break-even, either grow revenue, raise CM rate, or reduce fixed costs.
typical_action_lever: volume growth, price, fixed cost cuts

description: Sensitivity of operating profit to revenue changes.
interpretation_hint: High leverage amplifies both upside and downside; requires revenue stability.
